> On 6/11/02 2:44 AM, "sudipto  chattopadhyay" 
> <c_sudipto2002@...>
> wrote:
> 
> > is there any way to test gui components using junit. if possible
> > then how can i do? anyone can suggest about this?
> > Sudipto
> 
> Sure. But first you have to decide which aspect(s) of the gui 
> you want to
> test. For many people, making the gui so stupid that it can't 
> possibly break

That is in fact the way I do it. But one problem I had was that my model
worked alright,
but when the GUI components attached themselves as listeners, some things
didn't work anymore...
(Such as the collection of listeners being modified during iteration to
update the listeners)

> and having it delegate to a class that can be unit tested, is 
> sufficient.
>
